titles: Iohn Taylor being yet unhanged sends greeting to Iohn Booker that hanged him lately in a picture, in a traiterous, slanderous, and foolish London pamphlet called A cable-rope double-twisted
author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.
notes: A scurrilous denunciation of Booker and all his works, in Taylor's usual style.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
keywords: Booker, John, 1603-1667. --  No mercurius aquaticus, but a cable-rope double-twisted for John Taylor.
